metadata.title: Architectural Decisions
metadata.purpose: Design decisions, technical content, and architectural discussion
metadata.projectPhase: Command System Enhancement with Universal Metrics

designPhilosophy.corePhilosophy: Implement persistent knowledge management methodology for AI-assisted development with feature-centric organization and universal standardized metrics

designPrinciples.rationale: Complex projects span multiple AI conversations with context limits, requiring external knowledge management for continuity
designPrinciples.application: Use CLAUDE.md as primary project state file with internal/ folder for detailed documentation
designPrinciples.tradeoffs: Additional file management overhead vs. maintained project context across sessions

designPrinciples.rationale: ALL project work organized around FEATURES.md as central repository for project state, progress tracking, and work prioritization
designPrinciples.application: Every session, task, and development activity references and updates feature codes with automatic detection workflow
designPrinciples.tradeoffs: Feature management discipline requirement vs. comprehensive project state visibility

designPrinciples.rationale: Consistent metrics across all projects with hardcoded reference codes (M001-M010) enable cross-project comparison and universal targets
designPrinciples.application: Commands create/manage METRICS.md with standard template, calculate metrics from FEATURES.md and TASKS.md data
designPrinciples.tradeoffs: Universal metric constraints vs. consistent project measurement and performance standards

designPrinciples.rationale: Prevents documentation sprawl and ensures information is organized in designated locations with strict table discipline
designPrinciples.application: ALL information must go to designated canonical files, TASKS.md and FEATURES.md contain ONLY data tables
designPrinciples.tradeoffs: File organization flexibility vs. consistent project structure and information placement

architecturalDecisions.title: Adopt Feature-Centric Project Management Framework
architecturalDecisions.context: Need to organize project work around central repository with automatic feature detection and state synchronization to replace scattered task management
architecturalDecisions.decision: Implement FEATURES.md as central repository for all project features with automatic state machine workflow and emoji-based state tracking
architecturalDecisions.rationale: Provides comprehensive tracking, automatic feature detection, clear project state visibility, and eliminates command sprawl through consolidation

positive: Complete project state visibility through feature tracking with scores and metrics
Automatic feature detection when user mentions new capabilities
Clear project scores and progress metrics calculated from feature states
Unified development workflow around features eliminates scattered documentation
Command consolidation from 17 to 6 commands while preserving functionality
negative: Requires discipline in maintaining feature linkage and state updates
Additional overhead in feature state management and confirmation protocols
Learning curve for feature-centric development approach
risks: Feature management could become unwieldy with very large projects (>200 features)
Dependency on feature tracking for project continuity creates single point of failure

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Task-centric development with separate feature tracking
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - creates disconnect between daily work and feature progress, requires synchronization

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Traditional documentation approach with manual tracking
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - insufficient visibility and automation for complex multi-session projects

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Hybrid approach with multiple tracking systems
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - leads to conflicts and inconsistencies as seen with TodoWrite vs task command issues

implementation.approach: Gradual migration from 17 commands to 6 feature-centric commands with consolidated functionality
implementation.effort: Complete command system transformation with functionality preservation

validation.criteria: Command system operational with feature-centric capabilities and 100% functionality preservation
validation.method: Deploy and test feature-centric commands with real project usage
validation.evidence: ‚úÖ VERIFIED: Feature-centric command system operational in Session 6, successfully used through Session 8

architecturalDecisions.title: Implement Universal Standardized Metrics System
architecturalDecisions.context: Need consistent metrics tracking across all projects with hardcoded reference codes to enable cross-project comparison and universal performance targets
architecturalDecisions.decision: Implement universal metrics M001-M010 with standardized calculations, targets, and automatic calculation from project data
architecturalDecisions.rationale: Provides consistent project measurement framework across all projects with universal targets, eliminates metric conflicts, establishes clear authority hierarchy

positive: Consistent metrics across all projects enable comparison and benchmarking
Hardcoded reference codes (M001-M010) provide universal standards
Automatic metric calculation reduces errors and ensures accuracy
Universal targets (90% implementation, 80% coverage, 70% quality) provide clear goals
Clear data hierarchy: FEATURES.md + TASKS.md ‚Üí METRICS.md ‚Üí other files
negative: May not capture all project-specific nuances requiring P## metrics
Requires discipline in maintaining accurate metric calculations
Additional complexity in command system for metric management
risks: Universal metrics may not be appropriate for all project types
Metric calculation errors could affect project assessment and decision making

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Project-specific metrics only without universal standards
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - no consistency across projects for comparison and benchmarking
Rejected - error-prone, inconsistent, and requires manual maintenance

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Mixed metric authority across multiple files
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - causes conflicts and inconsistencies as documented in Session 8

implementation.approach: Commands create/update METRICS.md with standard template if missing, self-sufficient for any project
implementation.timeline: Session 8 implementation with command system audit
implementation.effort: Universal metrics integration across all commands with calculation automation

validation.criteria: METRICS.md created with M001-M010 universal metrics, calculations accurate, targets enforced
validation.method: Test metric calculation accuracy and validation against known project data
validation.evidence: ‚úÖ VERIFIED: METRICS.md created with universal metrics system in current session

architecturalDecisions.title: Establish Exclusive Task Command Authority
architecturalDecisions.context: Conflicts between TodoWrite tool and task command causing inconsistencies, multiple task management systems creating synchronization issues
architecturalDecisions.decision: Prohibit TodoWrite usage and establish exclusive task command authority for all task operations via TASKS.md table system
architecturalDecisions.rationale: Eliminates conflicts, ensures single source of truth, provides better integration with feature tracking, maintains consistency

positive: Single unified task management system eliminates conflicts
No synchronization issues between multiple task tracking tools
Consistent task state across all operations and commands
Clear authority hierarchy for task management with feature integration
Better integration with FEATURES.md and automatic state updates
negative: Loss of TodoWrite tool functionality and existing workflows
All task operations must go through task command exclusively
Learning curve for exclusive task command usage
No fallback task management option if task command issues arise
risks: Task command must be robust enough to handle all task management use cases
No redundancy in task management if task command fails
Workflow disruption during transition from TodoWrite

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Allow both TodoWrite and task command with synchronization
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - too complex and error-prone to maintain synchronization, conflicts demonstrated in practice

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Use TodoWrite exclusively without task command
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - lacks integration with feature tracking system and canonical file structure

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Hybrid approach with different tools for different task types
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - increases complexity and potential for conflicts

implementation.approach: Add D101 directive prohibiting TodoWrite, remove all TodoWrite references from commands, update integration points
implementation.timeline: Session 8 implementation with command system audit
implementation.effort: Update all commands to remove TodoWrite integration and establish task command exclusivity

validation.criteria: Zero TodoWrite references in commands, all task operations via task command, TASKS.md is authoritative
validation.method: Audit all commands for TodoWrite references and task management integration
validation.evidence: ‚úÖ VERIFIED: No TodoWrite references remain in any command, D101 directive enforced

architecturalDecisions.title: Standardize ID Formats with Zero-Padding
architecturalDecisions.context: Inconsistent ID formats across commands (F001 vs F00001, T1 vs T000001) causing reference problems and formatting inconsistencies
architecturalDecisions.decision: Standardize all ID formats with proper zero-padding: F##### (features), T###### (tasks), D### (directives), M##/P## (metrics), S###### (sessions), G### (diagrams)
architecturalDecisions.rationale: Ensures consistent identification, proper sorting, clear referencing, and eliminates format conflicts across all project elements

positive: Consistent ID formats across all commands and documentation
Proper sorting behavior with zero-padded numbers
Clear cross-referencing between files and systems
Eliminates confusion from mixed ID formats
Professional appearance and consistent project standards
negative: Requires updating existing references to use new formats
Slight increase in ID length for readability
Need to maintain format discipline in future development
risks: Existing references may break if not updated properly
Format inconsistencies could reappear without enforcement

alternativesConsidered.alternative: Keep mixed ID formats for backward compatibility
alternativesConsidered.reason: Rejected - maintains confusion and inconsistency problems
Rejected - causes sorting problems and inconsistent formatting
Rejected - reduces human readability and sequential understanding

implementation.approach: Update all command templates and examples to use proper formats, add format validation and correction
implementation.timeline: Session 8 implementation with command system audit
implementation.effort: Systematic update of all ID references across all commands and documentation

validation.criteria: All commands use consistent ID formats, all examples follow proper patterns, cross-references are valid
validation.method: Comprehensive audit of all commands and documentation for ID format compliance
validation.evidence: ‚úÖ VERIFIED: All commands use unified ID formats, malformed IDs corrected throughout

dataModel.approach: File-based data model with JSON schema validation, markdown table storage, and strict canonical file system

entities.name: Feature
entities.description: Individual project feature with implementation and test tracking, central to all project organization

attributes.name: id
attributes.constraints: Pattern: F##### (5 digits, zero-padded), unique within project

attributes.name: name
attributes.constraints: Descriptive feature name, avoid marketing language

attributes.name: description
attributes.constraints: Clear, actionable description of feature functionality
attributes.description: Detailed feature description for implementation guidance

attributes.name: state
attributes.constraints: Values: not_implemented, implemented, failing_tests, passing_tests, tautological, critical

attributes.name: stateEmoji
attributes.description: Visual state indicator for quick status assessment

attributes.name: notes
attributes.description: Operational notes for dependencies, issues, progress

relationships.description: Features can have multiple tasks for implementation and testing
Features contribute to multiple calculated metrics

entities.name: Task
entities.description: Individual task with feature linking, dependency tracking, and exclusive task command management

attributes.name: id
attributes.constraints: Pattern: T###### (6 digits, zero-padded), unique within project
attributes.description: Unique task identifier for tracking and dependencies

attributes.name: featureId
attributes.constraints: Pattern: F##### (5 digits, zero-padded), must exist in FEATURES.md

attributes.name: task
attributes.description: Specific task description with success criteria

attributes.name: status
attributes.constraints: Values: pending, in_progress, blocked, completed, cancelled. Maximum ONE in_progress globally
attributes.description: Task completion status with workflow constraints

attributes.name: priority
attributes.description: Task priority for scheduling and resource allocation

attributes.name: category
attributes.constraints: Values: feature, bug, refactor, test, docs, setup
attributes.description: Task type for organization and workflow

relationships.description: Tasks belong to specific features and update feature states
Tasks can depend on other tasks for completion

entities.name: Metric
entities.description: Standardized project measurement with universal codes and targets

attributes.name: target
attributes.constraints: Universal targets for M02-M10, project-specific targets for P01+

attributes.name: calculation
attributes.description: How metric is calculated from source data

relationships.description: Metrics calculated from feature state data
Metrics calculated from task completion data

performance.throughput: Low volume operations, high consistency requirements
performance.latency: Immediate file operations with validation overhead
performance.availability: File system dependent, no external service requirements

integrationPatterns.description: Task completion automatically updates feature states with evidence recording and metrics recalculation

performance.throughput: Per task operation with feature and metrics updates

integrationPatterns.name: Universal Metrics Integration Pattern

performance.latency: Calculation time scales with project size

technicalConstraints.description: Maximum ONE task in_progress at any time across entire project
technicalConstraints.impact: Enforces focused work approach, prevents context switching, ensures clear work state
technicalConstraints.mitigation: Task command validates and prevents multiple in_progress tasks, automatic constraint enforcement
technicalConstraints.validation: Check TASKS.md for multiple in_progress entries, validate before status transitions

technicalConstraints.description: All ID formats must follow zero-padded patterns with proper lengths
technicalConstraints.impact: Consistent identification, proper sorting, clear cross-referencing across all project elements
technicalConstraints.mitigation: Commands validate and correct ID formats automatically, format enforcement in all operations
technicalConstraints.validation: Regex validation: F##### (features), T###### (tasks), D### (directives), M##/P## (metrics)

technicalConstraints.description: Canonical file system only - no creation of non-canonical .md files
technicalConstraints.impact: Prevents documentation sprawl, ensures information organization, maintains project structure
technicalConstraints.mitigation: Commands prevent non-canonical file creation, move content to appropriate canonical files
technicalConstraints.validation: Scan for non-canonical files, validate information placement in designated files

technicalConstraints.description: Table discipline for TASKS.md and FEATURES.md - data tables only, no prose
technicalConstraints.impact: Clean data structure, prevents information bloat, maintains table readability
technicalConstraints.mitigation: Commands strip prose sections, move detailed content to appropriate canonical files
technicalConstraints.validation: Check table files for prose content, validate notes column length limits

technicalConstraints.description: TodoWrite tool prohibited - exclusive task command authority
technicalConstraints.impact: Single source of truth for task management, eliminates conflicts and synchronization issues
technicalConstraints.mitigation: D101 directive enforcement, remove all TodoWrite references, task command exclusivity
technicalConstraints.validation: Audit commands for TodoWrite references, ensure all task operations via task command
